event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_START

"The planet below hasss the mossst dangerousss arboreal creature in the galaxy. With itsss innate psssychic powersss, it isss asss formidable in battle asss it isss at sssubverting your mind. Mossst ssspeciesss won't cut it. It can't even be ssstunned. Our Ssslugsss can help, but are not ssstrong enough on their own."

choice.text: Ask them why they don't just use their ship mounted weapons.

event.text: "Do you have no underssstanding of what it meansss to hunt the beassst? If we ussse ssship grade weaponsss, we have not accomplissshed anything. choice.text: (The One Who Rhymes) "Everyone should stand aside. Let me be your horror guide!"

event.text: "Oh the years, how long it's been? That I should see the Fox again. How he hungers, how he yearns, oh how much his stomach churns. For dreams and flesh alike, he needs. His weakness is two mouths to feed. Now let's feed him all he craves, and end the lives of all these knaves." The One Who Rhymes places the beast directly onto the Clansman's ship. The panic and terror of the huntsmen is quickly silenced as the beast devours every single one of them. The One Who Rhymes provides you with the bounty of their ship.

"Now he's fed and now he's free. The galaxy is his to see. He'll spy a snack, he'll meet a meal, he'll make the useful people kneel. There is so much for him to know, think of all the places he'll go!"

choice.text: (Siren Crew) Your Siren may prove useful.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_MID_PYRRHIC

The beast immediately charges the Siren, identifying it as the biggest threat. Somehow, the creature's mental faculties seem to cloud in the presence of the Siren, who uses this to its advantage, fighting defensively as the Clansmen are able to get clean shots off at it. However, your Siren doesn't seem to care much for the lives of the huntsmen, and some of them are injured.

The beast immediately charges the Siren, identifying it as the biggest threat. Your crew evades its attack, as the Clansmen are able to get clean shots off. Eventually, the creature goes absolutely berserk, tearing the hunters apart, before the Siren finally pacifies it long enough for one of the few remaining Slugs to end its life.

Vortigon's zealotry breaks through even the psychic beast's powers. The beast can neither subvert Vortigon's will nor meaningfully hurt him. Vortigon pins the beast in a grapple, and the Slugs are able to take it down without a single casualty.

Vortigon's zealotry breaks through even the psychic beast's powers. The beast can neither subvert Vortigon's will nor meaningfully hurt him. The Slugs adopt a formation around Alkali. Thanks to his keen xenobiological insights, the beast is unable to break the formation. However injured they get, the whole hunting party is able to receive as much medical assistance as they need.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_ALKALI_SUCCESS
event.text: The Clansmen adopt a formation around Alkali. The beast is able to tear into some of the Slugs, but he manages to keep most of them stable just before they drop. However, one of the flanking hunters gets a little careless, and is torn to pieces before Alkali can help.

Turzil directs the Clansmen with measured precision. Once the beast is baited, Turzil calls in the entire squad on his position. As his protective field generates around every Slug, they are virtually invulnerable to the creature's attacks, leading to a triumphant victory. The hunting party hails their victorious general.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_TURZIL_SUCCESS

After Turzil's field dissipates, the protection has faded, but the damage is done, and the beast is too hurt to capitalize on it properly.

The Cultist springs into action, taking their stimulants and rushing the creature. It is completely unprepared for the zealot's ordinary yet impenetrable mind, and cannot manage to attack. Even after the stims wear off, the beast is worn down and pinned, allowing for the hunters to finish it off.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_CULTIST_SUCCESS
event.text: The Cultist takes their stimulants and pursues the beast. With a savage zealotry, they rain down a barrage of blows, but as soon as the drugs wear off, the creature manages to get some distance between itself and your crew. However, at this point it is weak enough that the Slugs can handle it.

The Cultist takes their stimulants and pursues the beast. Despite your crew's zealotry, there is a small crack in their mental discipline that proves to be enough to let the creature avoid many of their strikes. Though the battle is eventually won with considerable casualties, your Rock was not able to give it their all.

Your Separatist goes nano-mode and swarms the creature. It wastes a lot of its energy just trying to fight the ghostly figure as it is pelted with the gunfire of the Slugs. Once a few blasts hit it, it ignores your Engi and starts wreaking havoc amongst the hunting party. Surprisingly, they still somehow win.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_SEPARATIST_FAILURE

As you recall your Engi to your ship, you begin to wonder what in the heck you were thinking with that move.

Your Defender takes point. The beast notices the shiny, seemingly defenseless figure and strikes, but their shield protects it both from physical and mental attacks. Your crew holds on tight to the creature as the hunting party fires upon the creature from afar. It's not too difficult for the beast to break free of the Engi's hold, but the damage is done. Unfortunately, it still tears the hunting party apart.

Your Defender takes point. The beast momentarily attacks, but quickly gives up once it strikes the shield. The hunting party is rendered defenseless against the creature, as it completely ignores your Engi. At least you were able to get your crewman back.

"Ah, oh well. Thanksss for atleassst entertaining the idea..."
"That there'ss a... well I don't actually know the name. They're jusssst lizard thingsss I guessss."
"Oh, well thanksss for your busssinesss! That'sss probably my firssst profit in... well ever. Guessss ssetting up ssshop in a nebula wasssn't a good idea."

"Y-you want all of them? Well I'll be... You either REALLY like my plussshiesss, or you're one hell of a philanthropissst. I'll tell you what, sssince my busssinesss here ain't going too well, I think I'll ssstick with you for a while!"
"Well, good bye then. Thanksss for making my day, traveler!"
"Ah, oh well. Thanksss for at leassst entertaining the idea..."
Once again, your murderous tendencies have taken the spotlight, and you are now attacking more people.
You have better things to do than visiting random tourist traps.

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_SHELL_MECHANIC
event.text: A Shell Mechanic resides here. They contact you the moment you arrive. "Are you here to oppose thhhhe Guild? Or are you here to support thhhhem?"
"Thhhhen you shall die withhhh thhhe rest of thhhe occupiers!"
"Thhhhen do as you will. But don't hesitate to kill any Clansmen who get in your way."
"Thhhhen you are nothhhing but a neutral coward. Get out of here."
"If you aren't opposed to thhhhem, thhhhen you support thhhhem." The ship charges weapons!
"Do you have anybody to vouch for your claims...? If not, thhhhen we appreciate your support, but we must be cautious. Farewell."

event.name: CLAN_MECHANIC_BELIEF
event.text: "Ahhhh, so you are an ally, thhhhen. Would you like us to patch up your ship? Or are you more in need of supplies?"
"Good choice, it is what we pride ourselves on."
"We can spare a few. Make good use of thhhhem."
"We can spare a few. Make good use of thhhhem."
"If you need scrap thhhhat badly, we can give you some of our reserves. Don't waste it."
"Thhhhen good luck out thhhhere."

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_SHELLANGRY
event.text: A civilian Shell ship has found themselves deep in Guild space, but they don't seem scared of the ravenous hunters out there looking for blood. Instead, they look furious to see you here. "Oh great, now thhhhe Federation is getting involved with thhhe Guild? Why don't you get a conscience and stop killing innocent people you scum!"

choice.text: How dare you call us scum!

event.text: You try not to think about how you're proving the Shell's point and prepare to defend yourself... through violent murder.

Your Shell reasons with the others, explaining you're only going through this sector to get to Node 17 on your mission. Luckily, the Shells are reasonable and apologize, and offer some fuel and scrap to aid you.

Your Monk reasons with the Shells, explaining you're only going through this sector to get to Node 17 on your mission, and that immediately accusing foreigners of having blood on their hands is an irrational behavior. Luckily, the Shells are reasonable and apologize, and offer some fuel and scrap to aid you.
You shut down the Shell ship's oxygen, frightening them into submission. "Ok, I'm sorry we called you scum! We surrender!"

You talk to the Shells and try to reason with them. Luckily, Shells are creatures of science and logic, and not usually stubborn or malicious like Zoltans or Slugs. They seem to understand they were mistaken and let you past.

You talk to the Shells and try to reason with them. Luckily, Shells are creatures of science and logic, and not usually stubborn or malicious like Zoltans or Slugs. They seem to understand they were mistaken and let you past.
In the end, it seems your reasoning doesn't work. The Shells still accuse you of being a murderer (of which you technically are) and attack!

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_SHELL_RADIANT
event.text: You almost immediately receive a brief message from a nearby Shell Radiant vessel. "Might want to hurry away, Renegade. Thhhe Geniocracy has dispatched military forces to thhhis sector and thhhings might get messy soon."

choice.text: What's the Geniocracy doing in Guild space?

event.text: You aren't sure if you expected a response, but fortunately a friendly Radiant appears on the screen, who's more than willing to talk. "Thhhe EHG has been hunting our species for far too long. We didn't want to risk an all out war with thhhe Kleptocracy, but it's time we finally take a stand. We will drive thhhhe Guild out of thhhis sector and force the Kleptocracy to regulate thhheir activity, or die trying. And I don't plan on dying."

choice.text: Defend the Guild and attack the Radiants!

event.text: You aren't quite sure how to justify your actions, but you're sure you can think of something convincing later. For now, time to fight!

choice.text: Offer your assistance to the Shells.

event.text: "You want to help? Well I suppose it doesn't hurt. We could use some supplies if you have any."
"Thhhhank you Federation. Well since we have plenty of missiles now, I guess we don't need thhhis drone."
"Thhhhank you Federation. Well since we have plenty of drone parts now, I guess we don't need thhhis weapon."
"I have a feeling you aren't part of thhhhe Geniocracy... buuuuuut we Shells must stick togethhhher. Maybe thhhhis will help?"
"Thhhank you Federation. And may you have good luck with your mission as well."

choice.text: Abide by their warning and leave.

event.text: You now have some time on your hands.

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_SUZERAIN
event.text: The nearby system holds a Suzerain muttering to himself as they fly through the nebula. They don't seem to care much about your presence here.
"No bother me! Guild stealing all of kills. What happen to time when Hive most feared, and claimed all prey? Space now Clan territory, disgusting!"

"Haha, stupid Federation captain thinking all nebula sector once nebula sector! Haven't ever heard of Coalition Cealaforming tech? Guild, trading with Coalition, buying many many cealaformer to make this sector!"

choice.text: Yeah, I think I've fought one of those before.

event.text: "Having you? Then you do good service to all galaxy! Slug thinking they can make everything nebula? Well they wrong! Federation got them, apparently! Hahah! This service cannot go unpaid!"
"Of course not having met one! Secret Coalition tech, not for Federation knowing! Wait, oh I make an oopsie. Cannot let anyone know I told you this!"

choice.text: Why? Is the Guild not part of the Kleptocracy, which is part of the Coalition?

event.text: "Well, yes. But Guild conversion of sector not Kleptocracy doing. And Coalition much like Federation, have own hangar, budget, soldier. They not just giving Cealaformer away to hunter."

choice.text: If the Guild wasn't supposed to use Cealaformer tech here, why did the Coalition sell it to them?

event.text: "Probably because Slug doing dirty behind other member back! Or... I not knowing. All I know is this not once nebula sector, and now Guild stealing all precious prey here!"

choice.text: Is this sector home to some exotic species?

event.text: "Yes and no. Most, Guild bring here themselves. Look, asking too many question! I said not bother me, and you bothering me!"
"Yes yes, whatever. Now leave!"
"GAH! YOU SO ANNOYING! DIE!"

choice.text: But aren't the Mantis and Slugs allied? Through the Coalition, that is?

event.text: "No no, tiny Federation brain fail to understand. See, Coalition is much like Federation. Engi, Zoltan, Orchid, Human, except with better race, like Mantis... and other ones."
"Gah! You not understanding. Yes, we ally. But Coalition border not work like Federation border. All race keep to own territory, and share Coalition territory."

choice.text: Wouldn't that mean the EHG is only hunting in Slug territory?

event.text: "Are deaf? You miss entire point! EHG should only hunting in Slug space. This NOT Slug space! This sector claimed after Slug Expansion Wars end. Filthy Slugs never follow treaties!"

choice.text: Why don't the other members of the Coalition step in?

event.text: "Rockman not caring, Leech too busy. Hive afraid of more conflict, hit very hard during Expansion Wars. It seeming like I only one who caring..."

choice.text: Why not take matters into your own hands?

event.text: "And do what? I one Mantis. Slug, many many Slug. You thinking I can kill entire Kleptocracy by self? You stupid man! Your brain size of Algerian Berry! Haha! That very small, if not knowing. I saying you dumb. Now leave alone."

"At least Federation biding by border laws, even if always argue with each other. Coalition is too weak, doom to fail. Perhaps it time to seek alternative before I caught in crossfires of civil dispute..."

"HAHAHAHAH! You very funny! And also dumb. I not joining Federation in million year! You no space for Mantis, too busy letting Free Mantis ruin your land. Now, you have wasted enough of time. Get gone."

choice.text: (Hive Mantis Crew) Convince him to join you.

event.text: "Federation having Mantis? I here thinking only Free Mantis welcome. Federation might be in bad spot, but not bad as Coalition! I take offer, captain."

choice.text: Why not go solo? Surely as a Suzerain you could be a famous bounty hunter in no time.

event.text: "Oooh! Federation making the good idea now! Yes, claws sharp, claws kill! I be rich in time not at all! You are genius, even if still smelly and stupid. For your most intelligent idea accepting this, I not needing it soon enough!"

choice.text: What treaty? Who did this land belong to first?

event.text: "After Slug Expansion Wars Coalition form and make pact, none take land from other race. Each race has own expansion law, Slugs let keep all of nebula. This sector within Hive limits, yet Slug take it first!"

choice.text: Why not take matters into your own hands?

event.text: "And do what? I one Mantis. Slug, many many Slug. You thinking I can kill entire Kleptocracy by self? You stupid man! Your brain size of Algerian Berry! Haha! That very small, if not knowing. I saying you dumb. Now leave alone."

event.text: "Federation having Mantis? I here thinking only Free Mantis welcome. Federation might be in bad spot, but not bad as Coalition! I take offer, captain."

choice.text: Why not go solo? Surely as a Suzerain you could be a famous bounty hunter in no time.

event.text: "Oooh! Federation making the good idea now! Yes, claws sharp, claws kill! I be rich in time not at all! You are genius, even if still smelly and stupid. For your most intelligent idea accepting this, I not needing it soon enough!"

choice.text: Couldn't you just ask for permission to hunt here? The EHG seems fairly friendly to tourists and outsiders.

event.text: "Oh! For once, Federation have good idea. Why not thinking that, instead of killing Slug... You make good point. I pay you for having smart brain and helping me."

choice.text: But don't you all hate each other?

event.text: "Yes, of course! Slug greedy, Rockman slow, dumb. Leech smelly, reminding me of old corpse as I wishing they were. Mantis not standing these, but Hive say alliance good for keeping Slug out of Mantis territory."

choice.text: Wouldn't an alliance mean more Slugs are in Mantis Territory?

event.text: "If it were dumb Federation, yes! But we smarter, alliance not grant permit for other race in other territory. Coalition territory shared, all others independent. Vital for Coalition survival. Making sense to you?"
"Good. Now stop talking me, very boring and tiresome."
"Gah, very annoying. Ask too many question, not understand anything! Federation captain miniscule intelligence, I will kill!"

choice.text: I see. This definitely answers my question.

event.text: "Good. Now stop talking me, very boring and tiresome."

choice.text: I feel you man. Slugs suck.

event.text: "Yes yes, we agree on this. Glad see other rational thinking man in space, even if smelly Fed! We Slug hater must band together, and fight off smelly Slug." The Suzerain is so pleased with you agreeing with him he even offers to patch up some of your hull damage.

choice.text: This guy is in a bad mood, don't bother him.

event.text: You don't know why the Hive has one of its most feared warriors so far out in Slug space, but it's probably not good.

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_TAX
event.text: You've only just barely entered the beacon when a Clansman ship flies past, tailed by several large Clairvoyant vessels. You know the EHG is still a part of the Kleptocracy, so you can't imagine why they might be sending the enforcers out here.
You pursue the Slugs through the nebula, where you find the Clansmen have hunkered up in a cave, and won't come out. The Clairvoyants appear to be at a loss.

"You ssssee, normally the Kleptocracy doessssn't get involved in EHG affairsss, but their membersss are ssstill citizensss of our nation, and they have taxesss to pay. Assss you can tell, the men who've locked themssselvesss in that cave owe... quite a lot."
"Ohhh, uh, about 17 million. In Kleptocracy Oseroes. If I wasss to transsslate that into ssscrap, which ssseems to be the currency around here, it comesss to around... 260 million."

choice.text: Use some missiles to blow the Clansmen out of the cave.

event.text: You lay the bombs all around the cave then wait for them to explode. The impact sends the cave crumbling in and forcing the Clansmen out, where they're arrested.

choice.text: Fight the Clairvoyants to aid the Clansmen.

event.text: You're known to be one to commit many crimes yourself in your travels. Though yours are normally warcrimes and this is a case of tax evasion, that doesn't mean you can't help a fellow criminal out. In the name of the Federation, of course.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Try to reason with the Clansmen.

event.text: Your Slug goes up to the awning of the cave, where he speaks with the Clansmen. Playing off of their better reason, he convinces them that dying trapped in a cave is a far worse fate than going to prison, even if it's a Slug one. This works, and the Clansmen surrender.

"Oh! Uh, sssir! I didn't sssee you there, my king. Er, ex-king. I don't... you don't really have authority over thisss sssir, but I'm a Clairvoyant, and I think you did great thingsss for our nation, even if you weren't the bessst leader at timesss. If you're willing to ssstand up for thessse men though, I won't quessstion it." The Slug clears their debts, then flies away.

choice.text: What a funky and unpredictable situation. Anyways, I'm bored; time to move on.

event.text: You now have some time on your hands.

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_TAX_SAVECLAN
event.text: You approach the Clansmen, who whisper "Are they gone?" Once you assure them the Clairvoyants are gone, they exit the cave and thank you. "Haha! Tax evasssion worksss out flawlesssly once again. Uh... I guessss I ssshould reward you. How about a reactor upgrade?"

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_TAX_SAVEKLEPT
event.text: "Ah, well that handlessss that. Thank you, Federation. Didn't know you had interessst in helping with Kleptocracy affairsss. Perhapsss a bit of scrap will help compenssate for your help in ressolving thisss isssue."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_CLAN_GHOST
event.text: You aren't sure from where, but you're receiving a hail from a Guild Ranger. "Up for a bit of work? Ssssome Ghossstsss sssstole my ssship! I intend to get it back, through any methodsss I can, and you look like a damn well efficient one."
"Good, good! Jusssst pleassse don't dessstroy it!"
You aren't some chump change mercenary. You have standards! You mute the Slug.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_CLAN_DUSK
event.text: A distress signal appears to be coming from a Clansman ship being pursued by a Duskbringer. You are promptly hailed: "Pleasssse help! We made a terrible missstake, trying to ssstudy how Dussskbringer explosssion tech workss on live captivesss... now they're mad and want usss dead. I'm not sssuprissed to be honessst but pleassse ssstill help?"
You arm the weapons and engage the Duskbringer vessel.
You arm the weapons and engage the Clansman vessel.
You mute the Clansmen and continue on with your unhelpful existence.

textList.name: NEBULA_CLAN_FIGHT
textList.text: The Exotic Hunter's Guild has many scouts patrolling this sector, alongside its usual hunters. When they spot you here, and recognize you as a Federation ship, they quickly arm themselves for battle. Their reasoning? Either they think you're a threat, or they want to make a coat out of your skin. Or both.
The silence of the nebula around you is starting to get to you. Fortunately, this beacon appears to be empt- oh wait, it appears you're mistaken. Clansmen inbound!
You catch a nearby Clansman watching you from a distance. "Well I'll be, that'ssss one fine ssset of teeth, mate! I'm gonna make a lovely necklace out of thossse!"

"An MV ssship? Didn't you get the memo? Thissss isss Guild territory! We didn't buy thisss land from the Kleptocracy jussst to have sssome freakin' interdimenssssional assshole pop in and sssteal all of our prey!"
A nearby Guild ship approaches, its weapons already charging. You have to admire the courage of these Clansmen, even if it usually ends with them dead.
"Hey, isss that a sssship over there? Oh crap, it issss!" A Clansman scrambles for his rifle then swerves his ship around to fight you!
The Clansmen are prestigious hunters who aren't known to pass up the chance for a quality hunt. While you might be a military vessel armed for combat, that doesn't seem to deter the nearby vessel.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_CLAN_STORM
event.text: This beacon is impaired by a passing ion storm. A Guild ship reveals itself, with obvious hostile intentions. It's unsurprising to say the least: these conditions only further encourage their tendencies to prey upon targets, as if they were encircling a beast caught in a bear trap.

textList.name: NEBULA_SLUG_CLAN_FIGHT
textList.text: Usually the Slug ships you expect to see here are property of the Guild, but sometimes standard Kleptocracy citizens make their way to this sector for a bit of hunting. And as usual, looks like you're the one being hunted!
"Federation! Thisss isss Kleptocracy ssspacce. Don't think jussst becaussse the Guild letssss in outsssidersss that you'll be welcomed by ussss!"
A Slug vessel is inbound! They might not be EHG, but they're still a hostile you need to eliminate or run from!
"You're the lasssst kill I need to passsss my memberssship exam and become a member of the Guild! Now sssstand ssstill, I'm tired of having to put effort into thisss!"
There's many Slugs in EHG space, but you didn't expect to see a standard Kleptocracy citizen. Not that you're surprised, but you are mildly displeased that they've already turned hostile!

textList.name: NEBULA_SHELL_CLAN_FIGHT
textList.text: You wouldn't be one to expect Shells to be so hostile, but apparently the ongoings of the Guild have really agitated the nearby ship, because they're already attacking!

Shells are normally very appreciative of science, but the ship here appears to have abandoned all reason and is attacking straight on. The Guild probably has something to do with this rash behavior, but it's too late to diagnose it now!

"You must run! My crew, thhhey have caught a rare case of space rabies from an Equinoid we recovered during a raid on a Guild stati-" The Shell is cut off as he is murdered by one of his friends, who moves to take control of the ship and attack.

event.name: NEBULA_CLAN_PHEROMONES
event.text: You've seen a lot of things in your travels, but you don't think you've ever seen the wastes of half a Mantis fleet lying before a Guild megastructure. A massive mechanic arm appears to be collecting the wrecks one by one and moving them towards a small docking bay.
You pilot towards the structure and enter through a hangar door, where you're greeted by a Clansman. "Oh god, you aren't here to ssshut usss down, are you?"

"Oh thank god. Wait, ssso why are you here? Have you come to watch my operation? Thisss here isss a pheromone extraction plant. The pheromone bussinesss isss booming, and we want to get a firm grip on it before thossse Free Mantiss bastardsss monopolize the whole thing."
"Pleasssure doing bussinessss with you! Jusssst don't tell the Federation. Or the Hive. Actually, jusssst don't tell anyone pleassse."

choice.text: Where did all the Mantis come from?

event.text: "Oh well uh... we bought them from the Ghosssstsss. Yeah, that sssoundsss... believable."

choice.text: Then where did the Ghosts get this many Mantis ships from?

event.text: "Thhhheeeee... Mantissss ssstore?"

choice.text: I didn't know that was a thing.

event.text: "Oh no yeah, it'sss definitely real! I can give you the coordinatesss, if you'd like!"
"Oh pissss off Federation! You can't judge me!" The Clansman scurries away and sounds the alarm. Looks like we have to fight!
"Uhhhh, ok..." The Clansman quickly draws out a pen and scribbles down some barely legible numbers, hands them to you, then scurries off.

choice.text: Sounds cool, but we don't have any reason to stick around.

event.text: If you don't want to risk ending up like these Mantis, you probably shouldn't get any closer.

event.name: CLAN_PHEROMONES_DEMAND
event.text: "Alright, you've killed my men, now what? Are you going to ssshut down my facility? Arressst me? Make me do an embarrassssing dance?"

You don't technically have the authority to do this, but that's never stopped you before. You pretend you know what you're doing and seize all that you can carry, then order them to close down the building. You know they probably won't, but in the end you got what you wanted.

You don't actually have handcuffs on you, and you aren't really sure what you're doing. Fortunately the Clansman doesn't seem to know Federation law very well either, so when you tell him it's standard for Federation criminals to do service aboard the ship holding the arrest, he doesn't question it.
Sorrowfully, the Clansman does a waltz, but eventually breaks down into a sobbing heap. You take pity on the poor creature and only steal some of his scrap instead of all of it.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Carry out this arrest in an official manner.

event.text: Your Zoltan breaks out a pair of handcuffs from somewhere and cuffs the Clansmen one by one. They order the facility shut down, citing various codes if you hadn't known better would have assumed were made up, then ushers the Clansmen aboard your ship and confiscated several crates of supplies. When you ask what happens next, your Zoltan shrugs and figures you might as well make use of all this.

event.name: NEBULA_QUEST_CLAN_PHEROMONES_STORE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Overly suspicious coordinates provided by a Ranger.

event.text: Even though it's more than likely that Clansman was lying, you still take a trip to the coordinates he specified. Fascinatingly, you see a junkyard of Mantis ships with a Ghost-populated Mantis ship guarding it.

choice.text: Excuse me, is this the Mantis store?

event.text: It takes a few silent moments until your translator can work out the quirks of Ghost dialect - "Yes, and welcome. We sell used Mantis ships. Our stock is greatly diminished after a large shipment was ordered by the members of a renowned Guild, but there's surely a pleasant model still available for your needs."

This is probably the most scrap you've ever spent on one item before, but hopefully it's worth it. The Ghosts bring over a Mantis ship, which you find still contains the corpses of the previous crew, and their weapons as well!
While you don't have much use for the ship itself, you might as well scrap all that you can. You start with the weapons...
You pull another weapon off of the hull.
You pull another weapon off of the hull.
You pull another weapon off of the hull.
You pull another weapon off of the hull.
You arm the weapons and attack the Ghost ship.

choice.text: Well, there's not much reason to stick around.

event.text: This is too much, even for you. Some things just aren't meant to be known, seen, or interacted with. This is one of those you reckon, and steer course as far away as possible.

event.name: NEBULA_QUEST_CLAN_PHEROMONES_STORE_CHOICE
event.text: The Ghosts are gone, but the shipyard still appears to have many Ghosts wandering about. Do you risk salvaging some supplies before you go?
You scrounge around in the Mantis ships and grab some more supplies, but an angry team of Ghosts climbs aboard to avenge their fallen friends!

choice.text: Don't take the risk and leave.

event.name: BOUGHT_THE_GHOST_SHIP
event.text: Though you've taken everything you need from the ship for now, you figure there's no harm in sending the wreck back to the Federation hangar... because why not?

event.name: PONY_WORLD
event.text: It seems you've stumbled across a lush planet teeming with all kinds of exotic life. Judging from the impossibly well kept grasslands and the breathtaking rock sculptures, it seems this must be one of the EHG's best maintained hunting grounds. These locations are reserved for only the wealthiest of customers, not just Clansmen, and are stocked with lifeforms bred offworld. The planet seems to be entirely untouched by infrastructure, though scans show a single abnormality. A ship is on the surface.

You fly your ship near the crashed ship, noticing that it's a Guild vessel. It's incredibly old however and shows signs of rusting. Several brightly colored equinoids graze nearby, and you watch them peacefully roam when a voice speaks to you. "Do not disturb the equinoids, friend. They are tortured souls, the Guild is not kind."

You spin around but see no one. You lay your eyes on a hazy grey cloud that seems to engulf the area in front of you but are uncertain what it is. "Do not be afraid. We are nothing but an ancient voice. We are the Story Teller, and we have been an overseer of these lands for many years. Would you like to hear a story?"

You take a seat next to the grazing ponies, and one wanders over and plants its muzzle on your shoulder. The clouds move around you in seemingly patternless motions as he begins his story. "Once, many years ago, there was a boy who would come here with his uncle. His father was gone, and his mother dead. His uncle was a proud man, but the boy was meek. These trips were unusual and not an easy liberty, but his uncle wanted so desperately to earn the boy's affection."

"At first they came and simply watched the wildlife, but they never got too close. His uncle forbade it. One day, his uncle brought a gun. He showed the boy how to use it, and shot a bird from the sky. But all the boy did was cry. His uncle did not understand, and every day this would repeat itself. The pair would come, an animal would die, the boy would cry. The boy wielded the gun several times, and he fired it with deadly accuracy, but never once would he hit an animal. Instead, he would shoot cans and stones."

"One day, his uncle simply gave up. He stayed in his ship and let the boy free. He hoped he would learn to grow cold once he saw the equinoids did not share the same love for him as he did for them. But the boy would eagerly spend every day feeding the equinoids in bliss. The equinoids treated them as one of their own foals. The boy and the equinoids had more in common than the boy's own uncle. Bastardized and left without a home, forced into a new purpose by a master who did not understand their true nature."

"Every day the boy would beg his uncle to travel here, and every day his uncle's jealousy grew. How could the boy love a mindless alien more than his own flesh and blood? One day, the equinoids roamed further than they had before, and the boy followed. Soon, he even left the sight of his uncle, who in a panic realized he had lost track of the precious child and rushed after him. The boy wandered aimlessly but never afraid until he found a wreck. Mossy and rusted the ship lay in a state of disrepair, piloted by a lost Engi."

"The Engi was wounded, having been shot down by a Clansman who had seen through the disguise of his stolen craft. The Engi, too, had befriended the equinoids, and the equinoids thought it was time the boy meet the Engi. Good friends the two became, and for hours they talked of nothing in particular. The Engi had seen many things in his travels but understood little, while the boy had been so sheltered yet understood everything he had seen. The boy taught the Engi many things, and the Engi amused the boy with many stories."

"As night fell, the boy grew tired and bid the Engi goodnight. He walked away, guided once again by the equinoids. The boy never returned. We do not know what happened to him. We miss his voice. The equinoids make good company, but they do not understand our stories..."

choice.text: I assume you are the Engi in the story?

event.text: "Yes. But we are that Engi no more. We have been separated from the Harmony for so long we can hardly remember what it was like. We are nothing but guardians of this place. Many ships come and go. We do not mind them, as long as they do not disturb the equinoids..."

choice.text: No, but we'll stay for a while.

event.text: "Good. It is rare someone takes the time to admire the beauty of foreign lands like these. Visitors come often, but they merely come and go in a hurry. We do not mind them, as long as they do not disturb the equinoids..."

choice.text: We don't have time for stories. We have to go.

event.text: "A shame. No one has time these days... Well, we shall not leave this place. Carry on traveler. If you ever change your mind, you know where we'll be..."
The EHG probably won't like you poking around their special hunting areas. Best not to risk it.

event.name: PONY_WORLD_HUNTERS
event.text: As if right on cue, a new vessel arrives. A dark black hull suggests this is some special, highly important Slug vessel. They don't seem to mind you and land nearby, drawing out their hunting gear and making pleasant small talk. That is, until the Story Teller wanders over to them, and politely asks that they move their vessel somewhere else so as to not disturb the equinoids. The Slugs break into laughter and immediately begin to aim their guns mockingly at the ponies.
As expected, the Slugs don't take kindly to you interupting them. "Why'sss a Federation ssship here anywayssss? Thissss isss Guild territory! Looksss like you jussst became our next hunt!"

choice.text: Seems trouble is brewing. Best we leave.

event.name: PONY_WORLD_WIN
event.text: The Slug vessel has been destroyed. Unfortunately the wreckage damages the landscape, but none of the animals are hit. While you are scrapping the wreckage you notice several Slugs are still on the ground tormenting the equinoids.

Before you can do anything, the grey cloud suddenly grows larger and conceals the Slugs in a curtain of grey. You hear a blood curdling scream and suddenly the cloud dissipates, leaving nothing but a puddle of lacerated flesh and blood. "We warned them not to disturb the equinoids... Some people simply do not listen..."

You watch as the Story Teller floats back to their ship, where it waits for you. "It is unusual that you chose to assist us. It is true you found this place because of our vessel, correct? Then take it. We have no need for it any more."
"Goodbye, friend. We will make sure your story does not go untold..."

choice.text: (Jerry) "I think I'm the boy in your story..."

event.text: The Story Teller drifts over to Jerry, and slowly begins to condense into the form of a crimson Engi. "Our friend. It has been so long since we have seen you... How have the stars aligned to grant us this reunion? We can still see the innocence in your eyes. We apologize for our ramblings. How we wish we could join you, but we cannot. What we can offer is a gift. We wish you the best of journeys, Jerry, and your friends. Now this story can finally have a happy ending..."

choice.text: Offer to take the Story Teller with you.

event.text: "We're afraid we must never leave this place. A good guardian would never leave behind that which they protect. You have no need for us regardless. We are not fighters. Do not worry, we will make sure your story does not go untold..."

event.name: SYLVAN_SALT_QUEST_INTRO_CHAOS
event.text: You step aboard the lodge, feeling almost as if you're meant to expect someone here. Yet, no one steps forward. You wander around until you catch an intriguing conversation between a Clansman and a pirate concerning an individual called the "Saltman". You sit down at the table adjacent to them and lean in closer to hear what they're saying.

Suddenly, you hear a loud and obnoxious voice ringing in your ear, that causes you to fall out of your chair. You look up and see the gnome has mysteriously appeared on the table and is now yelling at you. Annoyed at your strange behavior, the station owners ask you to leave. You apologize and blame it on the gnome, which only confuses them more. After some arguing back and forth whether the gnome is real or not, you head back to the ship and find a mysterious set of coordinates pinned to your dashboard with a note. "Please find him for me. -S"

event.name: SYLVAN_SALT_QUEST_DECLINE
event.text: "Ah... yessss my bad... shouldn't mix busssinesss and persssonal mattersss, yess..." Sylvan frowns, but keeps up his chipper tone. "Well, how about a trade anywayssss, sstranger?"
"Really jussst in the mood for sssaying no today, eh ssstranger? Oh well... Next time maybe." Sylvan quickly heads back to the lodge.

choice.text: Rule thy mind, rule they honor!

You have a good feeling this isn't even official nor following guild protocol, and that all of the scrap will be going to these Slugs right here. All the same, it allows you hassle free entry from this point forward - or at least until you break out the Salt Man.
You aren't willing to pay, which means your journey ends here.

choice.text: Calm down, we have to get you out of here first.

event.text:
Sylvan, with the help of Obyn and his crew, carry over a large crate of scrap. Obyn transfers over some blueprints for his vessel as well to you, figuring the Federation might have some use for them. Sylvan heads back to his ship, but Obyn stands between the three ships with a look of indecision on his face. Sylvan turns to look at him but Obyn shakes his head.
"I can't go with you, old friend. We just... well you know how it went. I can forgive, but I can't forget. You're a merchant, and I'm a bounty hunter. In this climate, I guess they're sort of the same thing, but there's a difference somewhere. And I still haven't given up on my quest. There's more of my people out there, I'm sure of it. I still remember the day I fled my colony... well, I have to keep looking. I can't just give up."

choice.text: You could come with us, be a hero, then continue your quest after.

event.text: "A hero of the Federation? You know how to win me over... I've tried being a bounty hunter, but things obviously didn't work well, and the life of a merchant isn't for me. I'm sure we'll see each other again Sylvan. As for you, Pepper." Obyn turns to face the Rockman you spoke with earlier. "I'm trusting you with my ship. Take good care of it." Obyn turns to you. "Now, shall we go? I see adventure on the horizon! Who knows, maybe on the way I'll find a clue. Only way to go is to stay hopeful." With that, he salutes to Sylvan and the two depart.

event.text: Obyn looks on in shock at what just happened. For once, he finally looks down and seems to be aware of the gnome's presence. "In all my years exploring the galaxy looking for more of my kind I have seen many, many strange things. But never once have I ever seen something like this. What ARE you? Gods? Is this gnome a god?" Obyn wavers, wobbling slightly in the legs.

choice.text: I have no idea what's happening either, but the gnome wants you to come with us.

event.text: "If the gnome wants me to come, then I guess I'm coming. God help us all. I guess I have no need for my ship anymore, so you can have it. Maybe it'll appease the gnome, who knows."
